titles.title: Agreeing to the conference requested by the Senate on the amendment of the Senate to the bill (H.R. 3064) making appropriations for the government of the District of Columbia and other activities chargeable in whole or in part against revenues of said District for the fiscal year ending September 30, 2000, and for other purposes.

action.text: The House Committee on Rules reported an original measure, H. Rept. 106-395, by Mr. Linder.
Rule provides for consideration of motion to agree to conference to H.R. 3064. Provides for the disagreement by the House on the Senate amendment to the bill.

calendar.text: Placed on the House Calendar, Calendar No. 132.

action.text: DEBATE - The House proceeded with one hour of debate on H. Res. 333.
The previous question was ordered without objection.

vote.text: On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to by voice vote.

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

bill.summary: 10/18/1999--Introduced. Provides that the House of Representatives disagrees to the Senate amendment on H.R. 3064 (District of Columbia appropriations) and agrees to the conference requested by the Senate.
